text:
Spring break: It’s the one event college students look forward to all year. After being locked away in the classroom doing assignments and projects, you can’t wait to escape the stress of school and embark on an adventure with some of your closest friends!

But first things first: packing. To help you prepare for your upcoming travels (we know you’re eager to get to that tropical destination or volunteer location), we composed the ultimate spring break packing list so you can stress less and focus your attention on having fun, or doing good, in the sun. Check out our list below!

Beach Bag

Tip: Get double duty out of your oversized beach bag by using it as your carry-on/personal item for traveling to your spring break destination. Plus, it’ll ensure you have all your important items next to you at all times.

Ticket(s) (for traveling and any events you’re attending)

Cell phone

ID (if you’re staying within the U.S., use your driver’s license, or if you’re traveling abroad, bring your passport!)

Sunglasses

Medications

Gum

Wallet (keep some cash on you in case you run into any issues with your cards)

Snacks

Reusable water bottle (make sure it’s empty if you’re going through airport security!)

Antibacterial gel

Headphones

A bikini and cover-up (in case your luggage gets delayed!)

Toiletries

Sunscreen (HC Pick: Alba Botanica Hawaiian Coconut Clear Spray SPF 50)

A sunscreen that has the moisturizing benefits of a lotion (HC Pick: Alba Botanica Hawaiian Green Tea Lotion SPF 45)

Shampoo, conditioner, and soap

Dry shampoo

Face wash

Pimple patches (because no one has time for pimples on vacay!) (HC Pick: Alba Botanica Acnedote Pimple Patches)

Deodorant

Toothbrush and toothpaste

Razor and shaving cream

Hairbrush

Hairstyling tools (i.e. hairdryer and curling iron for those beach waves)

Hair ties

Makeup

Face masks (for those relaxation days)

Tweezers

A mini first aid kit

Feminine hygiene products

Clothes

Tip: Get more out of your vacay wardrobe by sticking to a color scheme so you can mix and match different pieces.

3 to 5 swimsuits

3 tank tops and/or tees

3 going-out tops

Sweatshirt or sweater

2 going-out bottoms

2 pairs of shorts

Your favorite pair of jeans

2 to 3 cover-ups or casual dresses to throw on over your swimsuit

1 nicer dress for going out

Sandals

Flip-flops

Wedges

Sneakers and socks

PJs

Sweats

Leggings

Underwear and bras (at least one set for every day you’re there, plus 1 to 2 extra)

Basic, cheap jewelry you can wear with multiple outfits

1 cross-body bag for going out

Miscellaneous

Beach towel

Disposable camera (so you don’t have to worry about your phone or nice camera getting sandy or wet!)

Chargers (get a cheap portable phone charger for long days at the beach or while you’re en route)

A good beach read

Beach hat large enough to shield you from the sun

Koozies (May you always have a cool—and cute!—drink in your hand)

Mini emergency/first aid kit

Zip-lock bag or waterproof pouch for your wet swimsuit

Corkscrew

Check off all the items on this list and you’ll be sure to have the best. spring. break. ever. Happy vacay!
title: The Ultimate Spring Break Packing List

meta_data.description: Contrary to popular belief, you’ll need to bring more than bikinis and sunblock.
meta_data.abstract: Contrary to popular belief, you’ll need to bring more than bikinis and sunblock.
